headline: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Tech Stocks Jump as Trump Softens Stance on Fed and Trade
summary: The S&P 500 advanced 1.7% on Wednesday, April 23, as comments from the White House pointed to stability at the Fed and the possibility of easing trade tensions.

headline: NOC Q1 Earnings Call: Profit Miss Driven by B-21 Charges and Contract Delays
summary: Security and aerospace company Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales falling 6.6% year on year to $9.47 billion. On the other hand, the company’s outlook for the full year was close to analysts’ estimates with revenue guided to $42.25 billion at the midpoint. Its non-GAAP profit of $3.32 per share was 47% below analysts’ consensus estimates. The stock traded down 11.8% to $468.25 after reporting and hosting the earnings call.
